metadata.title: RHSA-2019:4191: sudo security update (Important)

platform: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5 Extended Lifecycle Support

metadata.description:
The sudo packages contain the sudo utility which allows system administrators to provide certain users with the permission to execute privileged commands, which are used for system management purposes, without having to log in as root.

Security Fix(es):

* sudo: Privilege escalation via 'Runas' specification with 'ALL' keyword (CVE-2019-14287)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

bugzilla.text: CVE-2019-14287 sudo: Privilege escalation via 'Runas' specification with 'ALL' keyword

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5 is installed
sudo is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
